documentation.name: t3ma
documentation.description: Fetches the Triple Exponential Moving Average (T3MA) for a given financial instrument.

symbol.description: Instrument symbol, which can be any equity, index, ETF, forex, or cryptocurrency (e.g., 'AAPL', 'EUR/USD', 'ETH/BTC').

interval.description: Interval between two consecutive points in the time series. Supported intervals include '1min', '5min', '15min', '30min', '45min', '1h', '2h', '4h', '1day', '1week', and '1month'.

format.description: Format of the response data, either 'CSV' or 'JSON'. Default is 'json'.

v_factor.description: Volume factor used in the calculation of the T3MA.

series_type.description: Type of series to use in the calculation. Supported values are 'open', 'high', 'low', and 'close'. Default is 'close'.

outputsize.description: Number of data points to return. Default is 30.

time_period.description: Number of periods over which to calculate the T3MA. Default is 9.

documentation.name: stock_v2_get_profile
documentation.description: Retrieves the company profile information for a given performance ID using the RapidAPI Morning Star service.

documentation.name: get_animes
documentation.description: Retrieves a list of animes based on specified search criteria and filters from the RapidAPI Anime API.

year_greater.description: Find animes released after the specified year.

media_type.description: Filter by media type (e.g., music, tv, ona, ova, movie, special).

year_less.description: Find animes released before the specified year.

status.description: Filter by anime status (e.g., currently_airing, finished_airing, not_yet_aired).

limit.description: Limit the number of results.

q.description: Search for animes by title in English or Japanese.

sort.description: Specify sort order, True for ascending and False for descending.

offset.description: Number of results to skip.

fields.description: Specify the fields to return (e.g., id, title, main_picture, etc.).

year_equal.description: Filter by animes released in the specified year.

source.description: Filter by source material (e.g., manga, visual_novel, novel, etc.).

order.description: Order results by a specific field.

documentation.name: list_titles
documentation.description: Fetches a listing of titles that match specified parameters from the Watchmode API.

genres.description: Filter results to only include certain genre(s). Pass in a single genre ID or multiple comma-separated IDs. Default is '4,9'.

limit.description: Set how many titles to return per page. Default and maximum is 250.

source_ids.description: Filter the results to titles available on specific sources by passing individual IDs or multiple comma-separated IDs. Default is '23,206'. Note: Only a single region can be set if this is populated.

source_types.description: Filter results to only include titles available on specific types of sources (e.g., subscription, free). Default is 'sub,free'. Note: Only a single region can be set if this is populated.

types.description: Filter results to only include titles available on specific types of sources (e.g., subscription, free). Default is 'sub,free'. Note: Only a single region can be set if this is populated.

regions.description: Filter results to only include sources active in specific regions. Currently supported regions: US, GB, CA, AU. Default is 'US'. Note: Only a single region can be set if source_ids or source_types are populated.

sort_by.description: Sort order of results. Possible values include: relevance_desc, relevance_asc, popularity_desc, popularity_asc, release_date_desc, release_date_asc, title_desc, title_asc. Default is 'relevance_desc'.

page.description: Set the page of results to return. Default is 1.

network_ids.description: Filter results to titles that originally aired on specific TV networks by passing individual IDs or multiple comma-separated IDs. Default is '1,8,12'.

release_date_start.description: Filter results to only include titles released on or after a specific date. Format: YYYYMMDD. Default is 20010101.

release_date_end.description: Filter results to only include titles released on or before a specific date. Format: YYYYMMDD. Default is 20201211.

documentation.name: getlistings
documentation.description: Retrieve a list of condominiums and townhouses in specified cities of Southwest Florida and the East Coast.

sort.description: Defines how the listings should be sorted. Supported values are 'RELEVANCE' (best match), 'NEWEST' (newest first), 'PRICE_LOW' (cheapest first), and 'PRICE_HIGH' (most expensive first). Default is 'RELEVANCE'.

offset.description: For pagination. Specifies the starting point in the collection of listings. For example, to get the first set of items, set offset to 0. Default is 0.

price_max.description: The maximum price in US dollars for the condos and townhouses. Default is 250,000.

city.description: The name of the city to search within. Supported cities include Cape Coral, Fort Myers, West Palm Beach, Lake Worth, Lantana, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Boca Raton, Pompano Beach, Fort Lauderdale, Naples, Tampa, and Saint Petersburg. Default is 'Cape Coral'.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return. Default is 50.

documentation.name: autocomplete_search
documentation.description: Search for titles and/or people by name or partial name, useful for building an autocomplete feature. The results include a `result_type` field indicating whether the result is a title or a person, along with an `image_url` for movie posters or headshots.

search_value.description: The phrase to search for, which can be a full title or person name, or a partial phrase. For example, searching for "The sha" will find the movie "The Shawshank Redemption".

search_type.description: Determines the type of search results. 1 includes titles and people (default), 2 includes titles only, 3 includes movies only, 4 includes TV shows only, and 5 includes people only.

documentation.name: country_region_cities
documentation.description: Fetches a list of cities within a specified region of a given country from the GeoDB API.

countryid.description: An ISO-3166 country code or WikiData ID.

regioncode.description: An ISO-3166 or FIPS region code.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve. Defaults to None.

hateoasmode.description: Include HATEOAS-style links in results. Defaults to None.

asciimode.description: Display results using ASCII characters. Defaults to None.

nameprefixdefaultlangresults.description: Match on names in the default language if a non-default language is requested when prefix-matching. Defaults to None.

timezoneids.description: Only include cities in these time zones. Comma-separated values. Defaults to None.

nameprefix.description: Only include cities whose names start with this prefix. If languagecode is set, the prefix will be matched on the name as it appears in that language. Defaults to None.

types.description: Only include cities of these types (comma-separated): CITY, ADM2. Defaults to None.

minpopulation.description: Only include cities with at least this population. Defaults to None.

languagecode.description: Display results in this language. Defaults to None.

offset.description: The zero-based offset into the results. Defaults to None.

maxpopulation.description: Only include cities with no more than this population. Defaults to None.

includedeleted.description: Whether to include any cities marked deleted. Options are: ALL, SINCE_YESTERDAY, SINCE_LAST_WEEK, NONE. Defaults to None.

sort.description: How to sort the results. Format: SORT_FIELD,SORT_FIELD where SORT_FIELD = elevation, name, population. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: overview

to.description: Narrows down the results to articles published before the provided date-time. The format should be `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm`. Example value: `2022-09-18T15:30`. Date-times in the future do not affect the result.

terms.description: Narrows down the results to articles that contain all the provided keywords. The terms should consist of one to three words separated by a dash. Example value: `election-campaign`.

location.description: The location for which rental ratings are to be fetched.

currency.description: The currency code for the rental ratings. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: get_cities
documentation.description: Fetches a list of cities within a specified region of a country using the provided RapidAPI key.

region_code.description: The code of the region for which to retrieve cities.

country_code.description: The code of the country which contains the region.

documentation.name: properties_get_broadband
documentation.description: Fetch broadband information for a given property listing.

listing_id.description: The ID of the property listing for which broadband information is to be retrieved. This value is typically obtained from the `/properties/list` endpoint.

documentation.name: qr_code_image
documentation.description: Generates a QR Code image of a specified size for a given URL.

size.description: The size of the QR code image. Default is 5.

url.description: The URL to be encoded in the QR code. Default is 'www.google.com'.

documentation.name: qr_code_image_generator
documentation.description: Generates a QR code image from a given URL using the QR Code Generator API.

url.description: The URL for which the QR code is to be generated.

documentation.name: scrape_links
documentation.description: Scrapes a specified number of links from the provided URL using the Scrapey Link Scraper API.

url.description: The target URL from which to scrape links.

maxlinks.description: The maximum number of links to scrape. Defaults to 10.

includequery.description: Whether to include query parameters in the links. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: ec
documentation.description: Analyzes a given password based on a variety of parameters and returns the analysis.

password.description: The password to be analyzed. It must be between 4 and 128 characters long.

penalty.description: The penalty applied to each character that is part of a word, number sequence, alphabet sequence, etc. The penalty is a float number in the range [0, 1], with a default value of 0.25.

outputformat.description: The format of the returned analysis. Allowed values are 'json', 'xml', and 'yaml'. The default value is 'xml'.

reqid.description: An identifier for this request. This string must match the regular expression `^(?i)[a-z0-9]{8,16}$`. If not provided, a randomly generated identifier will be assigned.

documentation.name: whole_foods_order
documentation.description: Places an order at Whole Foods.

store_location.description: The location of the Whole Foods store.

item_list.description: A list of items to order.

order_size.description: The size of the order. Allowed values: "small", "medium", or "large".

documentation.name: get_a_specific_item_by_id
documentation.description: Fetches a specific item from an API using its id.

is_id.description: The unique identifier of the item to fetch.

documentation.name: get_all_servers
documentation.description: Fetches a list of Minecraft servers with an optional limit on the number of servers returned.

limit.description: A string representing the maximum number of servers to return.

documentation.name: gamebans
documentation.description: Fetches game bans for a specified E-Sports game using the provided game ID.

is_id.description: The ID of the E-Sports game for which you want to retrieve the ban details.

documentation.name: find_longest_palindromic_substring
documentation.description: Finds the longest palindromic substring in a string.

documentation.name: stock_time_series
documentation.description: Fetches stock time series data and key news events for a specified period and symbol.

period.description: The period for which to return time series and key events. Supported values are:

symbol.description: The stock symbol (ticker) to query. Examples include:

language.description: The language code for the results (default is 'en'). Refer to ISO 639-1 for available 2-letter language codes.

documentation.name: short_ticker
documentation.description: Fetches the latest and daily average prices for the specified cryptocurrency in the given market and against the provided fiat currencies.

market.description: The market type, possible values include 'global' and 'local'.

crypto.description: The cryptocurrency to get ticker information for, default is 'ETH'.

fiats.description: A comma-separated string of fiat currencies to return values for, default is 'USD,EUR'.

documentation.name: getteamstats
documentation.description: Retrieves the statistics of a specific NHL team using the given team ID.

is_id.description: The ID of the team.

documentation.name: home_team_last_10_matches
documentation.description: Fetches the statistics and list of the last 10 matches played by the home team for a given team ID.

is_id.description: The ID of the home team for which to fetch the last 10 matches.

documentation.name: prediction_details
documentation.description: Fetches and returns detailed prediction information for a given football match.

match_id.description: The unique identifier for the football match.

documentation.name: daily_match_list_all
documentation.description: Fetches the daily match list including scheduled, live, and finished matches for a given date.

date.description: The date of the match in the format {dd/MM/yyyy}.

documentation.name: measure_distance
documentation.description: Calculates the distance between two geographic locations specified by their latitude and longitude coordinates, with an optional unit of measurement.

unit.description: Unit of distance measurement. Valid options are "km" (default), "mi", "ft", and "yd".

documentation.name: postcodes_postcode
documentation.description: Fetches addresses for a given UK postcode using the RapidAPI UK Postcode API.

postcode.description: The UK postcode to look up addresses for.

documentation.name: search_restaurants_by_town
documentation.description: Search for restaurants within a specified town or city using the Wyre Data API.

town.description: The name of the town or city to search for restaurants.

documentation.name: get_place_by_id
documentation.description: Returns a single Place identified by an ID.

is_id.description: ID of the Place.

language.description: Specifies a language (ISO 639-1) to get the localized name of the place. If translation is not available, the "localizedName" property will be null. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: get_hourly_forecast
documentation.description: Retrieves the hourly weather forecast for a specified city using the RapidAPI Cloud Cast service.

city.description: The name of the city for which to retrieve the hourly weather forecast.

documentation.name: weather_report
documentation.description: Fetches the weather report of a specified city using the Toolbench RapidAPI.

cityname.description: Name of the city for which the weather report is to be fetched.

documentation.name: actors_get_all_images
documentation.description: Returns all images of a specific actor or actress based on their unique identifier (nconst).

nconst.description: The unique identifier of the actor/actress. It typically starts with 'nm' followed by a series of numbers (e.g., 'nm0001667').

documentation.name: keyword
documentation.description: Retrieves Monthly Data and Search count for a given keyword from the Targeted Keyword Trend API.

keyword.description: The keyword to search data for.

documentation.name: politician_goverlytics_id
documentation.description: Retrieves information about a politician by their 'goverlytics_id' from the Goverlytics API.

goverlytics_id.description: The unique identifier for a politician in the Goverlytics system.

documentation.name: get_news_from_one_news_source
documentation.description: Fetches news articles from a specified news source and page number using the Sri Lanka News API.

page.description: The page number to retrieve news articles from. Different news sources may have varying numbers of articles per page.

source.description: The news source to retrieve articles from. Possible values include 'Lankadeepa.lk', 'Deshaya.lk', 'Ada.lk', 'BBCSinhala.com', 'Mawbima.lk'.

documentation.name: theaters_list
documentation.description: List theaters around a specified postal code or GEO location using the Flixster API.

longitude.description: The GEO longitude to search for theaters.

zipcode.description: The postal code to search for theaters. Default is '90002'.

latitude.description: The GEO latitude to search for theaters.

radius.description: The radius (in miles) around the specified location to search for theaters. Default is 50.

documentation.name: science
documentation.description: Fetches science news from Google News using the provided language region and RapidAPI key.

lr.description: The language region code (e.g., 'en-US') to filter the news articles.

documentation.name: calculate_quarterly_dividend
documentation.description: Calculates the quarterly dividend per share based on the total dividend payout and the number of outstanding shares.

total_dividend.description: The total dividend payout in USD.

documentation.name: stock_company_overview
documentation.description: Retrieve the overview details of a public company or stock, supporting multiple stock types such as stock, index, mutual fund, and futures.

symbol.description: The stock symbol (ticker) for which to obtain the overview. Examples include 'MSFT:NASDAQ', 'MSFT', '^DJI', 'VTSAX'.

language.description: The 2-letter language code indicating the language for the results, as per ISO 639-1. Defaults to 'en'.

documentation.name: get_latest_current_block
documentation.description: Retrieve the latest (current) block being mined on a specified blockchain.

chain.description: The blockchain to get the latest block from. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: bolivia_songs
documentation.description: Fetches the Bolivia Songs chart information for a given range and date.

range.description: The range of the chart to fetch.

date.description: The date for which the chart information is required, in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

documentation.name: billboard_global_200_year_end
documentation.description: Fetch the YEAR-END Billboard Global 200 chart information for a given year.

year.description: The year for which to fetch the chart data, in the format 'YYYY'. Defaults to '2022'.

documentation.name: is_sum_of_cubes
documentation.description: Checks if a number is the sum of the cubes of its digits.

num.description: The number to check.

documentation.name: keyword_search_with_ranking
documentation.description: Perform a keyword search at a specific coordinate (latitude/longitude) to find businesses and rank a specific business at that location. The ranking data can be determined by the business place ID or business name.

query.description: The Google Place ID of the business or the business name to match in results. Use the `match_type` parameter to specify the choice.

lng.description: The longitude value of the grid center coordinate point.

lat.description: The latitude value of the grid center coordinate point.

zoom.description: The Google Maps zoom level to use for the search on each grid point. Allowed values are 0-18. Default is 13.

match_type.description: The type of match to perform for ranking. Allowed values are 'place_id' or 'name'. Default is 'place_id'.

documentation.name: ip_reputation
documentation.description: Fetch detailed information about a specified IPv4 or IPv6 address, including geolocation, ISP or hosting provider, and history of abuse or malicious activity.

ip.description: The IP address to query for reputation information.

documentation.name: estimate_market_value
documentation.description: Estimates the market value of a car given its VIN and optionally its mileage using the Toolbench RapidAPI service.

vin.description: The Vehicle Identification Number of the car.

mileage.description: The current mileage of the car. Defaults to 50,000 if not specified.

documentation.name: get_list_of_top_level_domains
documentation.description: Retrieve an exhaustive list of generic and country code top-level domains (TLDs).

tlds.description: A comma-separated string of specific TLDs to query. If not provided, all TLDs are retrieved.

documentation.name: user_timeline
documentation.description: Fetches the tweet timeline for a specified user ID.

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the Twitter user whose timeline is to be fetched.

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination to fetch the next set of results. Defaults to 'HBaEgNKVxpvYtS0AAA=='.

count.description: Number of tweets to retrieve. Defaults to 10.

documentation.name: search_for_any_category_or_star
documentation.description: Search for images using a category keyword or pornstar name via the RapidAPI service.

search.description: The category keyword or pornstar name to search for.

documentation.name: user_follower_list
documentation.description: Fetches the follower list of a specified TikTok user.

user_id.description: The ID of the TikTok user whose followers are to be fetched.

time.description: The start time for fetching followers. Default is '0'.

count.description: The number of followers to fetch. Maximum is 200. Default is '50'.

documentation.name: get_all_details
documentation.description: Fetches all details of a YouTube video, stream, or shorts including captions, audio-only files, video-only files, and stream URL if available.

is_id.description: The unique ID of the YouTube video/stream/shorts.

documentation.name: video
documentation.description: Fetches all available information for a specific YouTube video using the provided video ID.

is_id.description: The unique identifier of the YouTube video.

documentation.name: search_suggestions
documentation.description: Fetches search suggestions for a given query using the Cheap YouTube API through RapidAPI.

q.description: The search query for which to fetch suggestions.

documentation.name: get_a_random_color
documentation.description: Fetches a random color or a specified number of random colors from the sRGB color space using the Toolbench RapidAPI.

quantity.description: The number of colors to return. The maximum is 50. Defaults to 2. Values greater than 50 will default to 50, and values less than 1 will result in an empty array.

documentation.name: gethistoricalscoresbyyear
documentation.description: Fetches historical Environmental, Social, Governance and Overall scores for companies based on the given year.

year.description: The year for which to fetch the historical scores (must be less than or equal to 2020).

content_type.description: The type of content to return. Default is None.

sedol.description: The SEDOL identifier of the company. Default is None.

isin.description: The ISIN identifier of the company. Default is None.

companyname.description: The name of the company. Default is 'Apple Inc.'.

documentation.name: coins_search
documentation.description: Search for available cryptocurrencies that match a given string.

string.description: A word or name to search for relevant cryptocurrencies.

time_utc_offset.description: UTC offset value in seconds (default is 28800, representing UTC+8).

lang_id.description: Language ID value, with a default of 1, corresponding to the all_langs/lang_ID returned from the get-meta-data endpoint.

documentation.name: continents
documentation.description: Fetches and returns a list of continents of the world localized to the requested language, with various filtering options.

fields.description: Specifies the fields to return for each continent. Options include 'iso_a2', 'iso_a3', 'continent_code', 'dial_code', 'currency_code', 'currency_num_code', 'currency'.

continent_code.description: Filters the results based on the 2-letter continent code.

lang.description: Two-letter ISO 639-2 language code to localize the continent names.

name.description: Filter results to contain the given continent name in the chosen language.

documentation.name: reverse_geocoding
documentation.description: Translates location coordinates into human-readable addresses using the Reverse Geocoding API.

query.description: The location coordinates to be translated into a readable address.

documentation.name: countries
documentation.description: List or search for countries of the world in different languages. This function allows filtering and specifying the fields to return for each country, such as ISO codes, currency details, and dial codes.

currency.description: Filter by the currency name in the chosen language.

dial_code.description: Filter by the country's dial code.

fields.description: Specify which fields to return for each country. Defaults to 'currency,currency_num_code,currency_code,continent_code,currency,iso_a3,dial_code'.

iso_a2.description: Filter by the 2-letter ISO country code.

name.description: Search string for the country name, can be partial.

limit.description: Limit the number of results returned. Defaults to 250.

iso_a3.description: Filter by the 3-letter ISO country code.

currency_num_code.description: Filter by the 3-digit numeric currency code (ISO).

lang.description: Language selection ISO 639-1 code. Overrides the Accept-Language header. Defaults to 'en'.

documentation.name: loginuser
documentation.description: Logs a user into the system using the provided username and password.

username.description: The user's username for login.

password.description: The user's password for login in clear text.

documentation.name: get_awesome_product_details
documentation.description: Fetches detailed information about a product using a given product ID from the Amazon Data Scraper API.

productid.description: The unique identifier for the product to retrieve details for.

documentation.description: Fetches PlayStation deals based on the specified count, using the provided RapidAPI key.

count.description: The number of games to fetch from the deals list. The minimum value is 0, and the maximum value depends on the total number of games available.

documentation.name: find_by_postcode
documentation.description: Fetch addresses for a given UK postcode using the "Find By PostCode" API.

postcode.description: The UK postcode for which to retrieve addresses.

documentation.name: geocode
documentation.description: Fetches geographical coordinates (latitude, longitude) and city name of a given address in Uganda using the Toolbench RapidAPI.

address.description: The address in Uganda to be geocoded.

documentation.name: search_restaurants_by_local_authority
documentation.description: Fetches all restaurants within a specified local authority using the Wyre Data API.

documentation.name: get_a_list_of_states

postcode.description: A valid Australian postcode to retrieve state information for.

documentation.name: get_ip_data
documentation.description: Fetch location-related data for a given IP address using the APIIP.net service.

callback.description: JSONP callback function name as per the APIIP.net documentation. Default is 'FUNCTION_NAME'.

ip.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address, or a comma-separated list of such addresses (limit: 50). Default is '67.250.186.196'.

language.description: 2-letter language code to customize the response language. Default is 'es'.

fields.description: Comma-separated list of response fields to retrieve specific data according to the APIIP.net documentation. Default is 'city,capital'.

output.description: Format of the API response, either 'json' or 'xml'. Default is 'xml'.

documentation.name: get_champions
documentation.description: Fetches a list of all champions from the League of Legends API, optionally in a specified language.

lang.description: The language in which to retrieve the champion information. Defaults to None, which retrieves information in English.

documentation.name: company_income_statement

symbol.description: The stock symbol (ticker) of the company for which to fetch the income statement. Examples: 'MSFT:NASDAQ', 'MSFT', 'AAPL'.

period.description: The period for which to retrieve the income statement. Options are 'QUARTERLY' or 'ANNUAL'.

language.description: The language to use for the results, specified as a two-letter language code as per ISO 639-1. Default is 'en'.

documentation.name: final_velocity

difficulty.description: The difficulty level of the charades word (e.g., 'easy', 'medium', 'hard'). If not provided, a random difficulty level will be used.

documentation.name: zipcode_by_city

address.description: The IP address to query. Must be in the format A.B.C.D (e.g., 73.9.149.180).

documentation.name: languages
documentation.description: Fetch a list of the world's languages, optionally filtered and translated.

lang_3.description: Filter by 3-letter ISO language code. Defaults to None.

iso_a2.description: Filter by 2-letter country code. Defaults to None.

fields.description: Select fields to include in the result (e.g., 'iso_a2,lang_3,flag'). Defaults to 'iso_a2,lang_3,flag'.

lang.description: Language code to translate the results into. Defaults to 'en'.

documentation.name: measure_distance_reverse

stop_address.description: The destination address for which the distance needs to be calculated.

start_address.description: The starting address for which the distance needs to be calculated.

unit.description: The unit of distance measurement. Valid options are 'km' (default), 'mi', 'ft', and 'yd'.

documentation.name: email_id

email.description: The email address to validate.

documentation.name: get_company_by_domain
documentation.description: Fetches company data using a given web domain.

domain.description: The web domain of the company to look up.

page.description: The page number of news articles to fetch.

documentation.name: get_chapter_by_bookname

documentation.name: titles_id_main_actors
documentation.description: Fetches the main actors of a title given its IMDb ID.

documentation.name: neuronal_activity_rate

synaptic_input_rate.description: The rate of synaptic inputs per second.

synaptic_weight.description: The weight of the synaptic input, denoting its influence. Defaults to 1.0.

decay_constant.description: The rate at which the neuron's potential decays. Defaults to 0.1.

documentation.name: cagr
documentation.description: Calculates the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of an investment.

start_value.description: The initial value of the investment.

end_value.description: The final value of the investment.

years.description: The number of years between the initial and final values.

documentation.name: calculate_angle
documentation.description: Calculates the angle between the hour and minute hands of a clock.

documentation.name: tokenize
documentation.description: Tokenizes a given value by making a request to the Tokenizer API endpoint. The value must adhere to specific character restrictions and size limits.

value.description: The text to be tokenized. The value must be 1KB or smaller and must not include any of the following characters: forward slash (/), backslash (\), number sign (#), question mark (?), or control characters ranging from U+0000 to U+001F (including horizontal tab, linefeed, and carriage return), and from U+007F to U+009F.

documentation.name: iso
documentation.description: Retrieves the ISO codes for a given country using the Metropolis API.

country.description: The name of the country for which to get the ISO codes.

documentation.name: search_patent
documentation.description: Searches for patents using a keyword and data source, and returns a list of patents.

q.description: Keyword used for searching patents.

ds.description: Data source to search for patents.

documentation.name: getlatestbysecuritiescode

documentation.name: stock_cashflow_statement

symbol.description: The stock symbol for which to fetch the cash flow statement.

documentation.name: metadata
documentation.description: Fetches the metadata information for cryptocurrency markets from the specified API.

asset_type.description: The type of the asset, e.g., 'spot' or 'futures'. Default is 'spot'.

market_venue.description: The trading venue where the asset is listed, e.g., 'BINANCE'. Default is 'BINANCE'.

symbol.description: The symbol of the cryptocurrency, e.g., 'BTC'. Default is 'BTC'.

base.description: The base currency for trading, e.g., 'USDT'. Default is 'USDT'.

data_type.description: The type of data to fetch, e.g., 'metrics'. Default is 'metrics'.

documentation.name: stock_index_trend
documentation.description: Fetch the index trend earnings history information for a specific stock symbol from the Yahoo Finance API.

symbol.description: The stock symbol to fetch the index trend data for.

documentation.name: whois
documentation.description: Fetch the WhoIS lookup data for a given domain using the specified Toolbench RapidAPI key.

domain.description: The domain name for which to retrieve the WhoIS data.

documentation.name: camelizer_get_prices

locale.description: The locale code to specify the Amazon region. Defaults to 'us'. Options include 'au', 'ca', 'fr', 'de', 'it', 'es', 'uk', 'us'.

documentation.name: get_advisories_by_vendor
documentation.description: Fetch advisories from CISA.gov for a specified vendor and provide information on current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits.

vendorid.description: The vendor ID for which to fetch advisories.

limit.description: The maximum number of advisories to retrieve. Defaults to 2.

info.description: Additional information flag. If set, includes more details in the response.

documentation.name: strain_type
documentation.description: Fetches a list of results based on the specified strain type from the Weed Strain API.

straintype.description: The type of strain to search for (e.g., Indica, Sativa, Hybrid).

documentation.name: teamnearmatches

is_id.description: The team ID for which to retrieve the near matches.

documentation.name: ufc_fight_night_kara_france_vs_albazi_june_03_2023
documentation.description: Fetch details of UFC Fight Night: Kara-France vs. Albazi on June 03, 2023.

offset.description: The starting point of records to return. Defaults to None.

limit.description: The number of records to return. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: text_sentiment_analysis
documentation.description: Analyzes the sentiment of the provided text using the Text Sentiment Analysis API.

text.description: The text to be analyzed for sentiment.

documentation.name: generate_random_string
documentation.description: Generates a random string of specified length and character types.

length.description: The length of the random string.

uppercase.description: Include uppercase letters. Defaults to True.

lowercase.description: Include lowercase letters. Defaults to True.

special_chars.description: Include special characters. Defaults to False.

documentation.name: find_missing_ranges
documentation.description: Finds the missing ranges between lower and upper in a sorted list of integers.

documentation.name: getcompanies
documentation.description: Fetches AI companies from a given page through the RapidAPI service.

page.description: The page number to retrieve companies from.

documentation.name: get_articles
documentation.description: Fetch and filter Google News articles based on various criteria.

language.description: The language code for the articles (e.g., 'EN' for English). Supported languages are: TR, EN, FR, DE, IT, ZH, ES, RU, KO, PT.

sort.description: The sorting criterion for the articles. Possible values are 'date:asc', 'date:desc', '_score:asc', and '_score:desc'.

required_props.description: Comma-separated list of required properties that an article must have to be included in the results (e.g., 'title,image').

cursor.description: The cursor value for pagination, allowing navigation to the next set of articles.

to.description: The ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss) specifying the end date for the articles.

limit.description: The maximum number of articles to retrieve per request. The maximum limit is 100.

is_from.description: The ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss) specifying the start date for the articles.

q.description: The search query string to find specific articles. Use 'AND'/'OR' for multiple terms and '-' to exclude terms.

documentation.name: getstats
documentation.description: Fetches the latest and historical coronavirus statistics data, including confirmed cases, deaths, and recovered cases, for a specified location.

location.description: ISO 3166-2 location code (e.g., "FR" for France, "US" for the United States, "US-CA" for California state, or "global" for worldwide statistics).

documentation.name: health
documentation.description: Fetches health-related news from Google News using the provided language region and API key.

lr.description: Language region for the news, e.g., 'en-US'.

documentation.name: my_images_by_id
documentation.description: Fetches generated images' information filtered by a unique ID.

uniqueid.description: The unique ID used to filter the generated images.

documentation.name: get_products_in_category

documentation.name: get_directions

destination.description: The destination specified as a free-text location query or latitude, longitude pair.

country.description: The country or region to use for the query, specified as a 2-letter country code.

arrival_time.description: Arrival time specified as a Unix-Timestamp in destination local time

language.description: The language to use for the query, specified as a 2-letter language code.

departure_time.description: Departure time specified as a Unix-Timestamp in origin local time

distance_units.description: The distance units in the response ('auto', 'km', 'mi'). Default is `None`, which

documentation.name: vehicle_attributes
documentation.description: Fetches all available options for a given vehicle attribute using the Toolbench RapidAPI.

attribute.description: The attribute options to be returned. Defaults to 'bodies.type'.

documentation.name: us_fl
documentation.description: Fetches current or historical gas price data for Florida.

documentation.name: actors_get_all_filmography
documentation.description: Retrieves the complete filmography of a specified actor or actress using their unique identifier (nconst).

documentation.description: Retrieves a comprehensive list of all available food items from the API with an optional limit on the number of items.

documentation.name: target_heart_rate

fitness_level.description: The fitness level of the user. Acceptable values are "beginner", "intermediate", and "advanced".

documentation.name: cities_get_information_deprecated

documentation.description: Fetches the market value of a vehicle based on its VIN (Vehicle Identification Number) using the Toolbench RapidAPI service.

vin.description: The vehicle identification number to query.

documentation.name: vin_decoder_basic
documentation.description: Decodes basic information from a Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) using the RapidAPI VIN decoder service.

muscle.description: The target muscle group for the workout.

location.description: The location for the workout (e.g., gym, home).

documentation.name: get_exercises
documentation.description: Fetch a list of exercises from the MuscleWiki API with optional filters.

force.description: Filter exercises by the type of force (e.g., push, pull). Defaults to None.

name.description: Filter exercises by exercise name. Defaults to None.

muscle.description: Filter exercises by targeted muscle group. Defaults to None.

category.description: Filter exercises by exercise category. Defaults to None.

difficulty.description: Filter exercises by difficulty level. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: suggestqueries
documentation.description: Fetches suggestions based on the given query using the specified RapidAPI key.

query.description: The search query for which suggestions are to be fetched.

documentation.name: all_crypto
documentation.description: Fetches a datatable of cryptocurrency information from the RapidAPI endpoint.

page.description: The page number of the data to retrieve. Defaults to '1'.

lang.description: The language code for the data. Defaults to 'en'.

documentation.name: market
documentation.description: Fetches market data from Brave New Coin API based on specified asset IDs.

quoteassetid.description: UUID of the quote asset to filter the market results. Only returns markets which include this asset on the quote side, e.g., USD = 'e77b9824-126a-418e-a69c-a2e682578e94'.

baseassetid.description: UUID of the base asset to filter the market results. Only returns markets which include this asset on the base side, e.g., BTC = 'f1ff77b6-3ab4-4719-9ded-2fc7e71cff1f'.

documentation.name: stock_get_stock_historical_price_data
documentation.description: Fetch historical pricing data for a given stock symbol over a specified date range and interval.

symbol.description: Ticker symbol for the stock (e.g., "AAPL" for Apple Inc.).

start_date.description: The start date for fetching historical data in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

time_interval.description: The time interval for the data; can be 'daily', 'weekly', or 'monthly'.

end_date.description: The end date for fetching historical data in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

region.description: The region for the stock market. Default is 'US'.

documentation.name: marketbyid
documentation.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific market based on the provided market UUID.

is_id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the market.

documentation.name: streams_investor_relations
documentation.description: Fetches the most recent messages posted by verified Investor Relations customers from the StockTwits API.

since.description: Returns results with an ID greater than (more recent than) the specified ID.

max.description: Returns results with an ID less than (older than) or equal to the specified ID.

limit.description: The number of results to return, default and max limit is 30. This limit must be a number under 30. Defaults to '20'.

callback.description: Defines your own callback function name for JSONP support, add this parameter as the value. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: calculate_median
documentation.description: Calculates the median of a list of numbers.

documentation.name: search_by_keyword
documentation.description: Searches for products using a specified keyword on the 1688 platform through the Taobao-Tmall Product Detail API.

keyword.description: The search keyword to look for products.

page.description: The page number for paginated results.

documentation.name: products_detail
documentation.description: Fetches detailed information of a product based on the given product ID and optional query parameters.

goods_id.description: The value of 'goods_id' field returned from the .../products/list or .../products/search endpoint.

currency.description: The 3-letter currency code. Defaults to 'USD'.

country.description: The 2-letter country code. Defaults to 'US'.

language.description: The 2-letter language code. Defaults to 'en'.

documentation.name: downloadmovie
documentation.description: Downloads a movie in the specified format using the given parameters.

is_id.description: Unique identifier for the movie.

format.description: Format to download the movie in. Supported formats are 'mp4', 'webm', or 'flv'.

hq.description: If set to True, downloads a higher-quality version of the movie. This is only valid for 'mp4' format.

documentation.name: define_a_word_search
documentation.description: Fetches the definition of a specific word from the Urban Dictionary API.

documentation.name: schoolname
documentation.description: Fetches all data from a specific school by its name using the Toolbench RapidAPI.

name.description: The name of the school for which data is to be fetched.

documentation.name: stock_get_daily_low
documentation.description: Fetches the daily low stock price for a given symbol from the specified region using the RapidAPI service.

symbol.description: The ticker symbol of the stock (e.g., "AAPL" for Apple Inc.).

region.description: The region code where the stock is listed. Defaults to 'US'. Valid options include 'US', 'BR', 'AU', 'CA', 'FR', 'DE', 'HK', 'IN', 'IT', 'ES', 'GB', 'S'.

documentation.name: note_duration
documentation.description: Calculates the duration between two musical notes based on their frequencies and the tempo.

freq1.description: The frequency of the first note in Hz.

freq2.description: The frequency of the second note in Hz.

bpm.description: The tempo of the music in beats per minute. Defaults to 120.

documentation.name: stochrsi
documentation.description: Fetches the Stochastic Relative Strength Index (STOCHRSI) for a given financial instrument using the Twelve Data API.

symbol.description: The instrument symbol, which can be an equity, index, ETF, forex, or cryptocurrency (e.g., `AAPL`, `EUR/USD`, `ETH/BTC`).

interval.description: The interval between two consecutive points in the time series. Supported values include `1min`, `5min`, `15min`, `30min`, `45min`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `1day`, `1week`, `1month`.

fast_dma_type.description: The type of moving average used for smoothing. Supported values are `SMA`, `EMA`, `WMA`, `DEMA`, `TEMA`, `TRIMA`, `KAMA`, `MAMA`, `T3MA`. Defaults to `SMA`.

series_type.description: The type of series data. Supported values are `open`, `high`, `low`, `close`. Defaults to `close`.

fast_d_period.description: The period for the fast D moving average. Defaults to 3.

outputsize.description: The number of data points to return. Defaults to 30.

fast_k_period.description: The period for the fast K moving average. Defaults to 3.

format.description: The output format of the API response. Supported values are `json` and `csv`. Defaults to `json`.

time_period.description: The period for the RSI calculation. Defaults to 14.

documentation.name: summary_details
documentation.description: Fetches and returns a detailed summary of any public stock using a given stock symbol.

symbol.description: The stock symbol for which to fetch the summary details.

documentation.name: stock_news
documentation.description: Fetches the latest news related to a specific stock symbol/ticker.

symbol.description: The stock symbol or ticker for which to fetch news. Examples include 'MSFT:NASDAQ', 'MSFT', '^DJI', and 'VTSAX'.

language.description: The language in which to return the results, specified as a 2-letter ISO 639-1 code. Default is 'en'.

documentation.name: get_10_year_historical_quarterly_prices
documentation.description: Fetch the 10-year historical quarterly prices for a given stock ticker.

ticker.description: The stock ticker symbol for which the historical data is to be fetched.

documentation.name: get_stations_within_1_km
documentation.description: Fetch the nearest EV charging stations within a 1 km radius from a given latitude and longitude.

region.description: The region code (us for United States, ca for Canada, uk for United Kingdom, nz for New Zealand, hk for Hong Kong).

latitude.description: The latitude of the location for which to find nearby charging stations.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location for which to find nearby charging stations.

documentation.name: get_web_detection
documentation.description: Detects web information for a given image using the Toolbench RapidAPI.

image.description: The URL of the image to be analyzed.

documentation.name: nsfw_image_classification
documentation.description: Classifies whether the image content at the given URL is inappropriate or not using the NSFW Image Classification API.

link.description: The URL of the image to be analyzed.

documentation.name: get_label_detection
documentation.description: This function interacts with the RapidAPI Label Detection service to get label information for a given image URL.

image.description: The URL of the image to be analyzed.

documentation.name: get_person_by_id
documentation.description: Fetches the information of a person from the system using their `person_id`.

person_id.description: The unique identifier of the person whose information is to be retrieved.

documentation.name: steam
documentation.description: Checks the availability of a given username on Steam using the Toolbench RapidAPI service.

username.description: The username to check for availability on Steam.

documentation.name: navigations_get_node_content
documentation.description: Fetches the content of a node in a navigation hierarchy.

is_id.description: The 'id' field value returned from the /navigations/get-root endpoint.

cat_id.description: The 'cat_id' field value returned from the /navigations/get-tabs endpoint.

language.description: The 2-letter language code (default is 'en').

currency.description: The 3-letter currency code (default is 'USD').

country.description: The 2-letter country code (default is 'US').

documentation.name: get_city_from_zipcode
documentation.description: Retrieves the city name for a given ZIP code using the Ziptastic API.

zipcode.description: The ZIP code to look up.

documentation.name: by_zip_code
documentation.description: Fetches weather data based on a given zip code using the Toolbench RapidAPI service.

zip.description: The zip code for which to fetch the weather data. If the country is not specified, the search defaults to the USA.

lang.description: Language in which to receive the output. Defaults to None.

units.description: Units of measurement to use. Available options are 'standard', 'metric', and 'imperial'. If not specified, 'standard' units will be used by default. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: weather_statistics
documentation.description: Fetches the average weather statistics for a specified location for the next 30 days.

units.description: Unit system to be used. Available values are:

place_id.description: Identifier of a place. If not provided, the location can be specified using `lat` and `lon`.

lon.description: Longitude in the format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4. Defaults to '-122.42282'.

lat.description: Latitude in the format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.4. Defaults to '37.81021'.

documentation.name: by_geographic_coordinates
documentation.description: Fetches weather data based on geographic coordinates.

lon.description: Longitude of the geographic coordinates.

lat.description: Latitude of the geographic coordinates.

units.description: Units of measurement. Options are 'standard', 'metric', and 'imperial'. Defaults to 'standard' if not specified.

lang.description: Language for the output. Defaults to the API's default language if not specified.

documentation.name: get_media_links
documentation.description: Fetches media links associated with a given watch ID from the Watch Database API.

watchid.description: The unique identifier for the watch whose media links are to be fetched.

documentation.name: web_search
documentation.description: Performs a web search using the specified query and parameters, and returns the search results.

q.description: Search query string.

num.description: Number of search results to return. Valid values are integers between 1 and 20, inclusive. Defaults to 10.

start.description: The index of the first result to return. Defaults to '0'.

gl.description: Two-letter country code to boost search results from that country. Defaults to 'us'.

lr.description: Restricts the search to documents written in a particular language. Defaults to 'lang_en'.

documentation.name: song_info
documentation.description: Retrieve basic information about a song from a given track URL using the SoundCloud API.

track_url.description: The URL of the track for which the information is to be retrieved.

documentation.name: get_search_keyword
documentation.description: Search for a keyword using RapidAPI and return related hashtags and places.

keyword.description: The keyword to search for on Instagram.

documentation.name: get_related_video_with_keywords
documentation.description: Fetches a list of related videos based on the provided keywords from the TikTok API.

keywords.description: The search keywords to find related videos.

count.description: The number of videos to return. Defaults to '10'.

publish_time.description: Filter videos by their publish time. Defaults to 0.

cursor.description: The cursor for pagination. Defaults to '0'.

region.description: The region to filter videos. Refer to the TikTok region list for details. Defaults to 'US'.

sort_type.description: Sort type for the videos. Defaults to 0.

documentation.name: label_template_brands
documentation.description: Returns the list of blank label sheet brands supported by Ecardify on the given date.

format.description: The paper size format, which can be either "Letter" (8.5 inch by 11 inch) or "A4" (210 mm by 297 mm).

documentation.name: get_all_images_of_an_collection
documentation.description: Fetches all images from a specified collection using the Pulsar6 API.

is_id.description: The ID of the collection to retrieve images from.

documentation.name: email
documentation.description: Validates the given email address using the RapidAPI email validation service.

email.description: The email address that needs to be validated.

documentation.name: v1_dictionary
documentation.description: Fetches the definition of a given word using the API Ninjas Dictionary API.

documentation.name: translate
documentation.description: Translates input text from one language to another using the provided RapidAPI service.

text.description: The text to translate.
text.default: If you dont know what language the text is written in, our API will detect the language of the original request.

tolang.description: The target language code for the translation.

fromlang.description: The source language code. If not specified, the API will attempt to detect the source language automatically. Defaults to 'en'.

documentation.name: dictionary_examples_temporarily_unavailable
documentation.description: Fetch dictionary examples for a given query and language using the RapidAPI service.

q.description: The query string to search for dictionary examples.

language.description: The language code for the dictionary examples.

documentation.name: year_end_billboard_200_albums
documentation.description: Fetch the Year-End Billboard 200 Albums chart for a given year and range.

year.description: The year to fetch the Year-End Billboard 200 Albums for.

range.description: The range of results to return (default is '1-10'). If not specified, all results are returned.

documentation.name: get_the_market_calendar
documentation.description: Fetches the market calendar for a given month and year using the Tradier API.

month.description: The month for which to retrieve the market calendar. Defaults to '11'.

year.description: The year for which to retrieve the market calendar. Defaults to '2013'.

documentation.name: market_get_movers
documentation.description: Get market movers for a given exchange and category.

exchange.description: The stock exchange to retrieve data from. Accepted values include US, ADX, AMEX, ATHEX, EURONEXT_BRU, ASX, BAHRAIN, BCBA, BCS, BELEX, BET, BER, BIST, BME, BMFBOVESPA, BMV, BSE, BSSE, BVC, BVL, BVB, BVCV, BX, CSE, DFM, DUS, OMXCOP, OMXTSE, OMXHEX, EGX, EURONEXT, EURONEXT_PAR, EURONEXT_AMS, EURONEXT_LIS, FWB, GPW, HAN, HKEX, HNX, HOSE, IDX, JSE, LSE, LSIN, MIL, MOEX, MYX, MUN, NAG, NASDAQ, NEO, NEWCONNECT, NGM, NSE, NSENG, NYSE, NZX, KRX, OTC, OMXICE, OMXRSE, OMXSTO, OMXVSE, LUXSE, OSL, PSE, QSE, SGX, SIX, SWB, SZSE, SSE, SET, TADAWUL, TASE, TPEX, TSE, TSX, TSXV, TWSE, UPCOM, XETR.

name.description: The category of movers to retrieve. Accepted values include volume_gainers, percent_change_gainers, percent_change_loosers, percent_range_gainers, percent_range_loosers, gap_gainers, gap_loosers, percent_gap_gainers, percent_gap_loosers. Defaults to 'volume_gainers'.

locale.description: The language code for the results. Defaults to 'en'.

documentation.name: categoryflag
documentation.description: Fetches the flag image of a specific category in PNG format from the Motorsport API.

flag.description: The name of the flag category to fetch.

documentation.name: tournament_teams
documentation.description: Fetches the list of teams participating in a specific tournament using the provided tournament ID and RapidAPI key.

tournamentid.description: The ID of the tournament for which to retrieve the list of teams.

documentation.name: matchh2hduel
documentation.description: Retrieves head-to-head duel information for a specific basketball match.

is_id.description: The ID of the basketball match for which to retrieve head-to-head duel information.

documentation.name: calendars_get_economic_calendar
documentation.description: Fetch the economic calendar for a specified date range and set of countries.

is_from.description: The start date in the format yyyy-MM-dd (e.g., '2022-08-21').

to.description: The end date in the format yyyy-MM-dd (e.g., '2022-09-05').

minimportance.description: The minimum importance level of events to fetch. Valid values are -1, 0, or 1.

lang.description: The language code for the response. Default is 'en'.

countries.description: A comma-separated list of country codes to include (e.g., 'US,EU,JP'). Default includes multiple countries.

documentation.name: transcripts_list_deprecated
documentation.description: Fetches a list of transcripts for a specific symbol.

is_id.description: Symbol to query for data. Only one symbol can be queried at a time.

until.description: The value of meta/page/minmaxPublishOn/min JSON object returned to load the next page. Defaults to None.

size.description: The number of items per response. Defaults to 20.

documentation.name: chi_square_independence_test
documentation.description: Performs a Chi-Square test for independence on a 2x2 contingency table.

contingency_table.description: A 2x2 contingency table represented as a list of lists.

significance_level.description: The significance level for the Chi-Square test. Defaults to 0.05.

documentation.name: shazam_songs_list_similarities
documentation.description: Fetches similar songs using the Shazam API.

is_id.description: The ID of the song for which similar songs are to be fetched.

locale.description: The language code for the results. Defaults to 'en-US'.

documentation.name: get_song_related
documentation.description: Fetches related content for a song using the YouTube Music API.

browse_id.description: The unique identifier for the song being queried.

documentation.name: get_artist_s_albums
documentation.description: Fetches and returns basic details about the albums of an artist from a given Spotify URL.

spotify_url.description: The URL of the artist's Spotify page.

documentation.name: list_weekly_top_albums
documentation.description: Fetches the weekly top albums from Spotify for a given date and region.

date.description: The date in `YYYY-MM-DD` format for which to retrieve the top albums. Leave blank to get the latest chart.

region.description: The region code (ISO 3166 alpha-2, e.g., `US`) for which to retrieve the top albums. Defaults to `global`.

documentation.name: postalcode
documentation.description: Fetches location information for a given US postal code using the Toolbench API service.

postal_code.description: The postal code or zip code for which to fetch location information.

documentation.name: getstatus
documentation.description: Fetches the status of the current session for a given phone ID from the Maytapi WhatsApp API.

phone_id.description: The unique identifier for the phone whose session status is to be queried.

documentation.name: article_index
documentation.description: Fetches an indexed list of articles from the RapidAPI endpoint with an optional limit on the number of articles returned.

limit.description: The maximum number of articles to return. Defaults to 1.

documentation.name: veiculo_tipo_id_marca
documentation.description: Retrieves a listing of vehicles for a given brand from an API.

id_marca.description: The ID of the vehicle brand.

documentation.name: consumer_phone_search
documentation.description: Search for people in the Data Axle database based on the provided criteria.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return.

packages.description: The data packages or filters to apply to the search.

query.description: The phone number to search for. Defaults to '(206) 555-1212'.

documentation.name: historic_event_by_year
documentation.description: Fetches historical events for a given year using the World History Timeline API.

year.description: The year for which historical events are to be fetched.

documentation.name: get_futured_playlists
documentation.description: Fetch featured playlists for a specific country and timestamp from Spotify.

timestamp.description: Date of the featured playlists in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd'.

country.description: Country code to fetch playlists for. Must be one of the following:

offset.description: Number of items to skip (default is 0).

limit.description: Maximum number of items to return (default is 20, max is 50).

documentation.name: india_songs
documentation.description: Fetch the India Songs chart information for a given date and range from the Billboard API.

date.description: The date for which the chart information is requested, formatted as 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

range.description: The range of chart positions to retrieve.

documentation.name: related_artists
documentation.description: Fetches related artists for a given artist ID using the Spotify RapidAPI.

artist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the artist to find related artists for.

documentation.name: get_podcast_metadata
documentation.description: Fetch full details of a podcast using its Show ID from Spotify's metadata API.

showid.description: The unique identifier for the podcast show.

documentation.name: quote_get_margin_requirements
documentation.description: Fetches the margin requirements for a given stock symbol from the Schwab API.

symbol.description: The stock symbol for which to retrieve margin requirements.

documentation.name: displacement
documentation.description: Calculates the displacement of an object given its initial velocity, acceleration, and time.

initial_velocity.description: The initial velocity of the object.

documentation.name: get_crime_rates_by_zip
documentation.description: Retrieve crime statistics for a given ZIP code using the Crime Data by Zipcode API.

zip.description: ZIP code to retrieve crime data for.

documentation.name: codepoint
documentation.description: Fetch detailed information about a Unicode codepoint using the Codepoints API.

codepoint.description: The hex number representing the Unicode codepoint.

documentation.name: block
documentation.description: Fetches information about a specified Unicode block from the Codepoints API.

block.description: The name of the Unicode block to retrieve information about.

callback.description: The JSON-P function name for the response. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: get_draw_result
documentation.description: Retrieve the draw result for a specified game in a given region and on a specific date.

game.description: The name of the game for which to retrieve the draw result. Use the **Game List** method to get available games by country in JSON format.

date.description: The date of the draw result to retrieve, formatted as 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

region.description: The region or country for which to retrieve the draw result. Use the **Region List** method to get available regions in JSON format.

documentation.name: v1_ownersearch
documentation.description: Performs a search on the owner name or postcode and returns details about the trademarks found for that owner. Duplicate owner results can be returned by this endpoint, especially when an owner had an address change.

search_keyword.description: The search keyword (e.g., 'ferr' will return results for 'ferrari'). Defaults to 'netflix'. Use literal 'null' if you don't want to use this parameter.

postcode.description: The postcode to filter the search results (e.g., '95066'). Use literal 'null' if you don't want to use this parameter. Note that attorneys might omit postcodes from filings, so those results cannot be returned as they don't have postcode attached as metadata.

documentation.name: list_users
documentation.description: Fetches and returns a list of users associated with a specified account identifier from the RapidAPI service.

aid.description: The account identifier for which the list of users is being fetched.

page.description: The page offset for paginated results. Defaults to None.

documentation.name: currencies_list
documentation.description: Fetch a list of all available currencies using the investing-cryptocurrency-markets API.

time_utc_offset.description: The UTC offset value in seconds. For example, UTC+8 is represented as 28800 (8 * 60 * 60). Default is 28800.

lang_id.description: The language ID as returned by the .../get-meta-data endpoint. Default is 1.

documentation.name: get_channel_description
documentation.description: Fetches the channel description from the Twitch API using the provided user ID.

userid.description: The ID of the user whose channel description is to be fetched.

documentation.name: wnba_schedule
documentation.description: Fetches the WNBA schedule data for a specified date using the provided API key.

month.description: The month for which to retrieve the schedule, as a string.

day.description: The day for which to retrieve the schedule, as a string.

year.description: The year for which to retrieve the schedule, as a string.

documentation.name: getallgames
documentation.description: Retrieve all games data using the RapidAPI service.

cookie.description: The cookie value to include in the query parameters. Default is 'i18next=es;'.

host.description: The host value to include in the query parameters. Default is 'www.mozzartbet.com.co'.

referer.description: The referer value to include in the query parameters. Default is 'https://www.mozzartbet.com.co/es'.

documentation.name: drivers_standings
documentation.description: Retrieve F1 drivers' standings data for a specified year.

year.description: The championship year for which to retrieve drivers' standings. Defaults to 2020.

documentation.name: provider3_live_match_id
documentation.description: Fetches live match details for a given match ID from Provider3 using the RapidAPI service.

is_id.description: The unique identifier for the match.

documentation.name: managerlastmatches
documentation.description: Gets the list of the last matches played by a football manager, paginated by the given page number.

is_id.description: The ID of the manager whose last matches you want to retrieve.

page.description: The zero-based page number of the results you want to retrieve.

documentation.name: pitstop_summary
documentation.description: Retrieves the pitstop summary for a specific race given the year and location.

year.description: The year of the race.

location.description: The location of the race.

documentation.name: get_pricing
documentation.description: Retrieves pricing information for a specified country or all countries.

country.description: An ISO Code representing the country you wish to retrieve the pricing for. If not specified, the prices for all countries will be returned. Examples include 'de' for Germany, 'uk' for Great Britain, and 'fr' for France.

format.description: The format of the response: either 'JSON' or 'CSV'. Defaults to 'JSON'.

documentation.name: getmessage
documentation.description: Retrieves message details based on the provided message ID using the Toolbench RapidAPI service.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to retrieve.

documentation.name: keyword_search_at_coordinates
documentation.description: Performs a keyword search at specific geographic coordinates for businesses using the Google Local Rank Tracker API.

query.description: The Google Place ID of the business or the business name to match against in results.

lng.description: Grid center coordinate point longitude value.

lat.description: Grid center coordinate point latitude value.

zoom.description: Google Maps zoom level to use for search on each grid point. Allowed values are 0-18. Default is 13.

documentation.name: getpastevents
documentation.description: Fetches past Azure events from the specified page using the given RapidAPI key.

page.description: The page number to fetch the past events from.

documentation.name: onpage_seo_analyze
documentation.description: Analyzes on-page SEO for a given website using the Toolbench RapidAPI service.

website.description: The URL of the website to be analyzed.

documentation.name: city_details
documentation.description: Fetch detailed information about a specific city using its ID from the RapidAPI service.

is_id.description: The ID of the city for which detailed information is to be retrieved.

documentation.name: pagesblanches
documentation.description: This function retrieves data from the Pages Blanches API for extracting email and phone information based on the given parameters.

pbpage.description: The page number of the search results to retrieve.

pbkeyword.description: The search keyword or term for the Pages Blanches query.

pblocation.description: The location to filter the search results.

documentation.name: api_analyze
documentation.description: Analyzes user data on TikTok, including engagement, hashtags, mentions, and recent videos.

sec_user_id.description: The unique security user ID of the TikTok user to analyze.

documentation.name: hashtag_feed_video_posts
documentation.description: Fetches a feed of video posts associated with a specific hashtag from the TikTok API.

fresh.description: By setting this value to 1, the function will return fresh (non-cached) data. Default is 0.

name.description: The hashtag name to query, e.g., 'summer'. Default is 'summer'.

limit.description: The maximum number of records to return. Default is None, which typically defaults to 20. The maximum permissible value is 20.

max_cursor.description: Pagination cursor for fetching more video posts. Use the cursor received from the previous request to get subsequent results. Default is None.

documentation.name: get_user_info_by_user_id
documentation.description: Fetch Instagram user information by user ID using the RapidAPI service.

is_id.description: The Instagram user ID for which the information is to be fetched.

documentation.name: all_coins_ticker
documentation.description: Fetches ticker information for a range of cryptocurrencies.

documentation.name: generate_avatar
documentation.description: Generates an avatar and returns it to the client based on the provided parameters.

randomizer.description: Bypasses caching to return random images. Any value can be used (default is 'anything').

name.description: The name for the avatar. Only the first character will be displayed (default is 'John').

bg_color.description: HEX code for the background color of the avatar, without the '#' (default is 'FF2029').

text_color.description: HEX code for the avatar's text color, without the '#' (default is '000000').

documentation.name: hourly_forecast
documentation.description: Fetches the hourly weather forecast for a specified ski resort.

resort.description: The name of the ski resort for which the forecast is to be fetched.

el.description: Specifies a part of the mountain. Accepted values are 'top', 'mid', and 'bot'. Default is 'top'.

units.description: Specifies desired units. Accepted values are 'i' (imperial) and 'm' (metric). Default is 'i'.

c.description: Limits the result to the current day only. Default is None.

documentation.name: nowcast
documentation.description: Fetches a 3-hour weather forecast in 15-minute time steps for a given location.

location.description: The geographic location for which the forecast is requested.

dataset.description: The set of weather variables to include in the response (default is 'full').

windunit.description: The unit for wind speed in the response, such as 'MS' (meters per second) (default is 'MS').

tz.description: The time zone for the response, using IANA time zone database names (default is 'Europe/London').

tempunit.description: The unit for temperature in the response, such as 'C' (Celsius) (default is 'C').

alt.description: The altitude of the location in meters (default is 0).

periods.description: The number of 15-minute time steps to include, with a maximum of 12 (default is 8).

documentation.name: getrank
documentation.description: Fetches the contest rank of a LeetCode user.

documentation.name: image_generation_endpoint

width.description: The width of the generated image. Defaults to 500.

backgroundimage.description: The URL of the background image. Defaults to 'https://source.unsplash.com/500x500/'.

height.description: The height of the generated image. Defaults to 500.

documentation.name: get_streamer_info
documentation.description: Retrieves information about a Twitch streamer using the provided channel name.

channel.description: The name of the Twitch channel for which information is being retrieved.

documentation.name: places_list_by_radius_nearby_search
documentation.description: Fetches objects closest to a selected point filtered by optional parameters.

lang.description: Language code (2 characters, ISO639-1). Available values include 'en' (English) and 'ru' (Russian).

radius.description: Maximum distance from the selected point in meters.

lon.description: Longitude of the selected point.

lat.description: Latitude of the selected point.

src_attr.description: Source of the object attributes, multiple sources can be separated by commas. Defaults to None. Available values include 'osm', 'wikidata', 'snow', 'cultura.ru', 'rosnedra', 'user'.

format.description: The output format. Defaults to GeoJSON. Values can be 'json', 'geojson', or 'count'.

kinds.description: Object category, multiple categories can be separated by commas. Defaults to None. See object category hierarchy at 'https://dev.opentripmap.com/doc/en/'.

src_geom.description: Source of the object geometry. Defaults to None. Available values include 'osm', 'wikidata', 'snow', 'cultura.ru', 'rosnedra'.

rate.description: Minimum rating of the object popularity. Defaults to None. Available values are '1', '2', '3', '1h', '2h', '3h'.

limit.description: Maximum number of returned objects. Defaults to None, with a maximum limit of 500.

name.description: Text string to search at the beginning of the object name (minimum 3 characters). Defaults to None.

page.description: The page number of results to start from. Default is 1.

output.description: The output from the bot in response to the client input for partial search.

order.description: The search field to order by. Default is 'id'.

documentation.description: Initiates a conversation with the Islam&AI Bot, utilizing chat history and an API key for authentication.

question.description: The question to pose to the Islam&AI Bot.

chathistory.description: The chat history to be included in the conversation. Defaults to a predefined string about a dua.
chathistory.default: What is Dua to recite when you see a miraculous thing like Islam & AI? | There is no specific dua (supplication) mentioned in the Quran or Hadith that is to be recited when witnessing a miracle. However, Muslims are encouraged to constantly remember Allah and express their gratitude to Him for the blessings and miracles they witness in their lives. In general, it is recommended to say 'Subhan Allah' (Glory be to Allah) when witnessing something amazing or miraculous

studies.description: Indicators to be included on the chart. Supports multiple values such as 'MACD', 'RSI', 'EMA'. Default is 'MACD'.

theme.description: The color theme of the chart. Supported themes are 'light' and 'dark'. Default is 'dark'.

interval.description: The interval of the chart. Supported intervals include '1m', '3m', '5m', '15m', '30m', '45m', '1h', '2h', '3h', '4h', '1d', '1w'. Default is '1d'.

width.description: The width of the chart image. Minimum is 320. Default is 800.

height.description: The height of the chart image. Minimum is 240. Default is 600.

timezone.description: The timezone for the chart. Default is 'Etc/UTC'. Refer to comprehensive list for other values.

language.description: Language for the given instructions in ISO 639-1 code format. Default is `en`.

voice_instructions.description: Enables voice instructions for text-to-speech engines. Default is None.

filename.description: The name of the file if the output `format` is `gpx` or `kml`. Default is None.

documentation.name: geocodingsearch
documentation.description: Performs a forward geocoding search using a free-form query string and optional parameters to specify query filters and output format.

q.description: Free-form query string for the geocoding search.

countrycodes.description: Two-letter country code as defined in ISO 3166-1 alpha2 to restrict search to a specific country.

json_callback.description: Name of JSON callback function for JSONP calls; use this when the format is set to JSON.

polygon_text.description: Include a textual representation of the polygon geometry in the output.

namedetails.description: Include detailed naming information in the output.

limit.description: Limit the number of search results.

viewbox.description: Specify a bounding box for the search area in the format 'x1,y1,x2,y2', where x is longitude and y is latitude.

format.description: Output format of the response (e.g., JSON).

polygon_geojson.description: Include GeoJSON representation of the polygon geometry in the output.

bounded.description: Use '1' to restrict the search area to the specified viewbox.

polygon_svg.description: Include SVG representation of the polygon geometry in the output.

polygon_kml.description: Include KML representation of the polygon geometry in the output.

polygon_threshold.description: Simplification threshold for the polygon geometry.

accept_language.description: Set the query and response language using two-letter language codes (e.g., 'en' or 'es') or a combination of language and region code (e.g., 'en-GB' or 'es-AR'). Default is 'en'.

addressdetails.description: Include detailed address information in the output.

page.description: Page number of results to return (1-indexed).

documentation.name: getgamecontent

is_id.description: The ID of the game. The first 4 digits identify the season of the game (e.g., 2017 for the 2017-2018 season). The next 2 digits indicate the type of game (01 = preseason, 02 = regular season, 03 = playoffs, 04 = all-star). The final 4 digits identify the specific game number. For regular season and preseason games, this ranges from 0001 to the number of games played. For playoff games, the 2nd digit of the specific number gives the round of the playoffs, the 3rd digit specifies the matchup, and the 4th digit specifies the game (out of 7).

documentation.name: aroon
documentation.description: Fetches the Aroon Indicator (AROON) for a given financial instrument symbol. The Aroon Indicator is used to identify trends, the beginning of a new trend, and its strength in price movements.
